quoteFirst: The foregoing resolutions were passed in the House of Assembly by a vote of seventy-three ayes to thirty-nine noes, and in the Senate by a vote of
quoteLast: , those in the negative, in both Houses, being all members of the dominant party, and those in the affirmative composed of the members of the opposition, and of those Republicans who were supposed to be prepared to meet the State of Virginia and other sister States, in the spirit of the resolutions adopted by the States of Virginia and New York.
title:
A Report of the Debates and Proceedings in the Secret Sessions of the Conference Convention
For Proposing Amendments to the Constitution of the United States, Held at Washington, D.C., in February, A.D. 1861
author: Chittenden, L. E. (Lucius Eugene), 1824-1900

quoteFirst: As the gale continued, with little remission, we rode till seven o’clock in the morning of the 10th, when, it being more moderate, we weighed, and stood in for the land, having at length determined to seek a passage along the shore to the northward, still keeping the boat ahead: during our run in we had from
quoteLast: fathom: after standing in about an hour, we edged away for three small islands that lay N. N. E. ½ E., three leagues from Cape Bedford, which the master had visited while we were in port.
title: The Three Voyages of Captain Cook Round the World. Vol. II. Being the Second of the First Voyage
author: Cook, James, 1728-1779; Banks, Joseph, 1743-1820 [Contributor]; Hawkesworth, John, 1715?-1773 [Editor]

title:
The Romance of Modern Invention
Containing Interesting Descriptions in Non-technical Language of Wireless Telegraphy, Liquid Air, Modern Artillery, Submarines, Dirigible Torpedoes, Solar Motors, Airships, &c. &c.
author: Williams, Archibald, 1871-1934

quoteLast: ,--Anderson of Tennessee and Varnum of Massachusetts joining the Federalists in opposition. The Regular Army Bill, which was in effect a bill to sacrifice the regular army, passed November 11, without a division.
title: History of the United States of America, Volume 8 (of 9)
author: Adams, Henry, 1838-1918

quoteLast: Perhaps you'd like to have a copy of the entry, Mr. Trewillian?"
